file-clerk 1.0.4 documentation

file_clerk package¶

Submodules¶

file_clerk.clerk module¶

A collection of functions for dealing with files and file content.

This was a library I created for previous projects that deal with files and file paths in order to get code from files, lists of files in project folders, file extensions, and allows us to capture just files of a particular type. I also developed my projects on Windows OS, so these functions were designed to work with the file paths on Windows, Mac, and Linux (Windows is the one with backslashes - wacky, I know.).

Typical usage example:

extension = get_file_type(“path/to/file.js”)

code_string = file_to_string(“path/to/file.html”)

project_path = “path/to/project” all_project_files = get_all_project_files(project_path) just_css_files = get_all_files_of_type(project_path, “css”)

file_clerk.clerk.clear_extra_text(my_text: str) → str[source]¶

Removes line returns and extra spaces from my_text.

Parameters:

my_text (str) – text which may include line returns or extra space.

Returns:

text without any line returns or additional spaces.

Return type:

stripped_text (str)

file_clerk.clerk.delete_file(filepath: str)[source]¶

deletes file in path but only if it exists

Parameters:

file_path (str) – The file location

Returns:

None

file_clerk.clerk.file_exists(file_path: str) → bool[source]¶

Returns True or False: whether file in path exists.

Parameters:

file_path (str) – The file location

Returns:

True or False: True if file exists False if not

Return type:

bool

file_clerk.clerk.file_to_string(path: str) → str[source]¶

Returns contents of file as a string.

Parameters:

path (str) – The path to a file using Posix format (forward slashes e.g. path/to/file.ext)

Returns:

The contents of the file in utf-8 string

format.

Return type:

file_text (str)

file_clerk.clerk.get_all_files_of_type(dir_path: str, filetype: str) → list[source]¶

returns all files of a particular type from a directory.

Parameters:

  • dir_path (str) – The path to a directory using Posix format (forward slashes e.g. path/to/file.ext)

  • file_type (str) – An extension in the form of a string (without the dot (html, css, js, etc.))

Returns:

A list of all html, css, and javascript files

Return type:

files (list)

file_clerk.clerk.get_all_project_files(dir_path: str) → list[source]¶

returns a list of all files from the directory in the path.

Parameters:

dir_path (str) – The path to a directory using Posix format (forward slashes e.g. path/to/file.ext)

Returns:

A list of all html, css, and javascript files

Return type:

files (list)

file_clerk.clerk.get_file_name(path: str) → str[source]¶

returns the name of the file in the path.

Parameters:

path (str) – The path to a file using Posix format (forward slashes e.g. path/to/file.ext)

Returns:

The name of the file (with extension)

Return type:

filename (str)

file_clerk.clerk.get_file_type(path: str) → str[source]¶

returns the extension of the file in the path.

Parameters:

path (str) – The path to a file using Posix format (forward slashes e.g. path/to/file.ext)

Returns:

The extension of the file type (without) the dot (eg. html, js, css, pdx, png)

Return type:

extension (str)

file_clerk.clerk.get_full_path_string(path: str)[source]¶

returns absolute path to file in relative path.

Parameters:

file_path (str) – The file location using the Posix format (forward/slashes)

Returns:

will be a WindowsPath (if Windows) or

PosixPath (if Mac or Linux)

Return type:

full_path (Path Object)

file_clerk.clerk.get_linked_css(contents_str: str) → list[source]¶

returns a list of linked CSS files.

Parameters:

contents_str (str) – HTML code from a file in string format.

Returns:

A list of all filenames extracted from CSS

link tags. Note: no external stylesheets will be included (only local files).

Return type:

filenames (list)

file_clerk.clerk.get_path_list(path: str) → list[source]¶

Returns a list of each path part using slash as separator.

Parameters:

file_path (str) – The file location using the Posix format (forward/slashes)

Returns:

A path of each folder in a path, with the

file at the end. Example: path/to/file.ext will be [“path”, “to”, “file.ext”]

Return type:

path_list (list)

file_clerk.clerk.remove_tags(element: str) → str[source]¶

Removes all HTML tags from another tag’s contents

Parameters:

  • element (str) – the contents of a tag as a string form which might or

  • tags (might not have extra tags (in particular inline) –

  • <em> (such as) –

  • <a> (or) –

  • etc.) –

Returns:

the contents of the tag minus any inner tags.

Return type:

tagless_content (str)

file_clerk.clerk.split_into_sentences(contents: str) → list[source]¶

Returns a list of each sentence from the text.

Parameters:

contents (str) – A string of text (typically from a tag) that most likely has punctuation.

Returns:

A list of each sentence from the text

each in string format

Return type:

sentences (list)
